description: Safety culture is a facet of organizational culture that captures attitudes, beliefs, perceptions, and values about safety.  A culture of safety is essential in high reliability organizations and is a critical mechanism for the delivery of safe and high-quality care.  It requires a strong commitment from leadership and staff.  In this course, a safe culture is promoted through the use of identifying and reporting patient safety hazards, accountability and transparency, involvement with patients and families, and effective teamwork.
name: Setting the Stage for Success: An Eye on Safety Culture and Teamwork (Patient Safety II)
